title: Mathematics Instructional Design Strategies Utilizing Mobile Social Media

context.prior_knowledge: Basic knowledge of advanced mathematics, basic proficiency in mobile device utilization, and over 3 years of teaching experience
context.additional_context: Course for pre-service teachers to learn effective integration of mobile social media into mathematics education in smartphone-based environments, emphasizing limited but interactive smartphone utilization

learning_goals: Learners can identify nine educational applications of mobile social media and apply them to mathematics instruction.
By reflecting on their private teaching theories, learners can transition to designing student-centered mathematics lessons.
Learners can establish a formative feedback system with large-scale learners using mobile platforms (e.g., KakaoTalk, Band).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
